name: Swissotel Amsterdam

reviews.text: Had an awesome time in Amsterdam as I always do. I had taken my Mother with me on this trip and she had arrived from Chicago a very weary traveler. Since no regular rooms were ready when we arrived at 10:00 Am the desk manager was kind enough to upgrade us to a granite covered two room suite for the duration of our trip. Of course as a gentleman I was sure to take good care of the person as I would suggest any courteous traveler who is looking for an upgrade might consider. Fabulous room complete with an endless supply of Lavazza expresso from an automatic machine. Very comfortabe beds. Spotless even in the public areas and located next door to the palace and walking distance to central station. You can catch a train to schipol every 10 or 20 minutes. Catch the local train right out front for a ten minute ride to the museums etc. Flower market is like two blocks away. Will be back here soon! I miss the staff already!

reviews.text: I stayed at the Amsterdam Swissotel for 7 nights in March/April 2007 and was extremely satisfied. The location is one thing but the service was without reproach. The room was a good size, the bed and pillows were very comfortable, the service was great. Upon arrival, there was a vase full of red tulips in the room as well as a fruit basket and a Toblerone, and a convenient coffee/tea machine. The desk comes with an ergonomic chair. A bathrobe and slippers are available. The business centre offers 3 computers with a printer and a fax. The exercise room is spacious with new equipment. A special little extra are the baskets of apples at the reception and in the exercise room. Also, a small Toblerone is left on your pillow every night and there are magazines and books on the bedside table as a helpful guide. The one thing that upset me was housekeeping. They kept calling on the days that I left the DO NOT DISTURB SIGN. This problem was quickly taken care of. Staff is friendly and efficient. I would return in an instant.
reviews.title: Would return to the Swissotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my wife have just come back from a three night weekend break in Amsterdam. We stayed at the Swissotel and we were so happy with the choice. We had booked a standard room and when we arrived 1230 the room was not ready, it was sorted by 1500 and although we did not haggle or kick up a fuss we were upgraded to a junior suite. The room was huge with a great bathroom, a bed that must have been 7' square and five windows overlooking Dam Square. The standard of the room, the quality of the overall hotal and most of all the service were absolutely excellent. If you are going to Amsterdam for a holiday and are looking for a great hotel in a central location I could not recommend it highly enough.

reviews.text: Stayed here for a week 4-11 to 4-18-09. We paid extra for a superior room which was still a bit on the small side. Room was clean and well serviced each day. Front desk staff was helpful. We never even considered using public transportation as all attractions were easily walkable. When we checked out there was an inaccurate charge on the final bill which they quickly removed. The hotel is in an extremely busy area. Lots of people and activity directly outside the hotel. Overall a nice stay in a unique city. Internet is free in the business center. The charge for internet access in the room is much too high.

reviews.text: I looked on Trip Advisor before booking a Hotel in Amsterdam. One title stood out for this Hotel. It said 'Location, Location, Location'. It was spot on. This Hotel is so central to everything and overlook the main buy square. Breakfast was not included in our package and we found it extremely expensive to have Breakfast in this Hotel, but it was very good food. Our room was at the front of the Hotel overlooking the square which was perfect. Our friends had rooms at the side. Their rooms, although large and comfy, overlooked a brickwall. Not so nice, but then who wants to spend their time in Amsterdam looking out of a Hotel window!!! The staff were very helpfull and friendly. There is an excellent steak House - Gauchos - around the corner. Best steak we've ever had!
reviews.title: Excellent location - hard to beat

reviews.text: The location of the hotel was fantastic, 2 seconds away from Dam Square and just far enough from the red light district. Rembrandt Square and Leidesplein easily accessible, either by taxi or by the bicycle taxis or a 15 minute walk. When we arrived at the hotel we were told that the hotel could not keep to the room rate that we were originally given and we were to be charged an extra £60 per night!!! The room we were given was supposed to be a premium room, it was really small with 2 single beds pushed together (apparently a kingsize). Our window looked out onto a building which was under construction so we had no sunlight at all. On a positive the room was cleaned everyday and we were given clean towels everyday. The room was very well sound proofed, once the window was closed you couldn't hear any noise from outside.
reviews.title: Great location, shame about the rooms!
Great location with 1 warning
reviews.text: All in all, the hotel location is fab but definitely not worth the money.

As location you won't do any better than this. But the standart rooms have no window. In fact there is a window that looks to an air shaft which is 1 meter away from the contruction next lot. Unless you are planning to spend every second outside, spending more money for a better room is a better plan. Otherwise even if you don't have claustrophobia, you'll have it by the end of your stay at the Swissotel's standart room.
reviews.title: Swissotel Amsterdam - not as good as expected...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and i stayed at this hotel during our first stay inamsterdam. As said in many reviews the location of the hotl is perfect. it is right in the centre of the city on Dam square near loads of shops restraunts and attractions. There is entertainment and street performers in summer at dam square which is good. The hotel staff were friendly upon arrival and check in (as well as check out) went without any problems. We were shown to our room which unfortunatly didnt have much of a view (a narrow shopping street at the back of the hotel) but we couldnt complain as we did go for the cheapest possible room. The room itself was a very good size. We had a huge double bed and had a lot of floor space. There was a tv with plenty of channels and a brilliant 'dolche gusto' type coffee machine which was refilled daily. The bathroom was modern, clean and generally nice with plenty of shower gels and shampoos etc. The bar/restraunt downstairs was very modern and very nice to sit in however the prices are very expensive. 2 vodkas and cokes came to about 14 or 15 euros!!! One morning also, we got 2 medium tomato juices and it came to 9Euros. We did not sample the food, but from what I saw on other peoples plates it looked the sort you would get in a top of the line restraunt. We liked every aspect of the hotel apart from the prices of food and drink, but it is to be expected as it is a 4star in the dead centre of a capital city. Right outside the hotel there are dozens of places to eat (chip stands, chinese noodle bars, steak houses, italian restraunts, indian houses, japanese places, burger kind, kfc) and drink which would not stretch your budget. Drinks can be expensive so look out for bars that have 2-4-1 promos which will make your money go further.
reviews.title: Best possible location and really nice hotel

reviews.text: I arrived tired on the train from Paris and was happy to see the hotel was within walking distance from the station. When I waked into the hotel I knew immediately that the huge amount of money ($440 for a superior room) was not going to go very far based on the virtually non-existant lobby. I got to my room and shocked to see the shabbyness of everything. There had been some remodeling done in the last several years but everything was dinged and dented with tacky bedspread and curtains. The view was out a maybe 2 foot wide window of a ventilation stack, I really was horrified since this is the most I have ever paid in my life for a hotel. I had just paid to $295 to stay on the left bank in Paris!

reviews.text: From the moment I walked into the room, I was not thrilled...This was a quiet weekend in Amsterdam, but my so-called "junior suite" was not up to par. The room was in the rafters, small, carpeted and not at all like the attractive room with hardwood floors advertised. The room also reeked of smoke. The staff for the most part seemed ditzy and unfocused. In fact, someone from the States attempted to call me during my stay, only to have hotel staff tell them that I was definitely not a guest at the hotel. There was a speaker in the bathroom that broadcast the television feed; the sound quality was horrible. Good luck trying to take a shower in the treacherous stall with curved glass doors. This was not a place to which I am likely to return.

reviews.title: Great Choice
reviews.text: I and my travel companions spent 5 nights at the Swissotel Amsterdam in March 2006. All in all, this was a good pick for us. The location could be no better, what with Dam Square and the city's trams at the hotel's front door. There are tons of shopping and dining options within a very short distance of the hotel. All major sites are within walking distance, or are accessed quickly via the city's tram network (which again stops in front of the hotel). Admittedly, this is a business class hotel, so despite that facility being very clean and modern, it nevertheless felt somewhat cold and generic. Rooms however were of a good size. Do note that should your room be at or near the front of the hotel, street noise (especially the trams) can be heard in the room with the window(s) closed. This is not a sound-proofed building. My travel party occupied 2 rooms during our visit. I was in a room near the front of the building, hence the noise previously described. My companions occupied a room near the rear of the building with a view on to an inner courtyard-type space. Their room was totally noise-free. I would like to make special mention of the hotel staff. Everyone employed by the hotel that we had contact with throughout our stay was very polite and very helpful. The front desk staff in particular were always knowledgable, helpful, and friendly. Also, the hotel's "Business Center" offered 2 computers with free internet access. This was a great feature that our travel party greatly appreciated. Should you stay at the Swissotel Amsterdam? Definite yes if traveling for business. As for the pleasure traveler, I would give the hotel an overall 8.5 out of 10.

reviews.text: We had a suite for 3 nights . Excellent location. Taxis however can’t stop in front of the hotel, so you have to bring all your luggage over the road that have heavy traffic (tram, cars, cycles and of course lots of pedestrians). We were a party of 5 even then the check in was speedy, perhaps a bit too speedy. For Amsterdam the price and size of the rooms was as expected (small rooms big price), breakfast was not included. Well maintained everything was working properly. Narrow hallway with cupboards ending in the living room. The living room had a writing desk, small coffee table a couple of chairs and a sofa. The TV in the living room was surprisingly small. The bedroom was quite large, more cupboards, TV and radio. The bathroom was surprisingly large with separate toilette and shower stall. Wooden floors in the living room, carpeted floors in the bedroom and tiles (walls and floors) in the bathroom. Turndown service every night, with the little chocolate on the pillow and bed rugs (a very nice touch). Bathrobes and somewhat liberal choice of amenities. Big soft towels and real water pressure. Requests were promptly completed. An overall pleasant experience.
reviews.title: Best Hotel Yet In Amsterdam

description: Swissotel Amsterdam boasts the best location in town, right at Dam Square in the heart of the city centre. Being just 20km from Schiphol Airport and a short walk from Central Station, this 4-star hotel offers a perfect base for your stay in Amsterdam. All major sights and attractions are within walking distance. Offering 110 soundproof rooms and suites, Swissotel Amsterdam makes a quiet and comfortable haven amidst a bustling density of high-end shops, restaurants and bars.All rooms include a Nespresso coffee machine and individually controllable climate control. Hotel guests have free access to Swissotel Amsterdam Fitness, featuring state of the art cardio-vascular equipment, and to the Business Centre, providing free internet and office supplies.
